posts.name: jimfl014
posts.cooked: Any thought of using the new Rev PDP instead of the CTRE PDP?  Meaning, the rest of the â€˜legacyâ€™ CTREâ€™ control system would remain

posts.name: Gus Michel II
posts.cooked: I didnâ€™t see any rules issues that would prevent it.  You can power all of the legacy control systems from the Rev PDH, though youâ€™ll want to buy some spare 10A fuses straight away, as you will need 10A fuses for both the RIO and the radio.

posts.name: Sky Captain
posts.cooked: They arenâ€™t incompatible, if you are going to switch, Iâ€™d recommend getting the new breakers asap as they go in and out of stock all of the time. Only the new breakers work in the new PDP, but they also work in the old PDP as well.

posts.name: sastoller
posts.cooked:
Sky_Captain:

Only the new breakers work in the new PDP , but they also work in the old PDP as well.

Hmmm. Iâ€™m not so sureâ€¦ The old 40A breakers do not look like they will physically fit in the new PDH . The new 40A breakers do not looks like they will physically fit in the 40A channels in the old PDP . I think teams will need to buy the new 40A breakers to use with the new PDH .

However, it appears that the old 30A/20A breakers are the same size as the new 30A/20A breakers so they should all work in the new PDH , right. Is there some reason they will not work?

Asking because I havenâ€™t had a chance to play with the new PDH or breakers. Maybe you have some knowledge or experience with these components that I do not.

posts.name: Mr.R^2
posts.cooked:
The old 20 and 30 Amp breakers do work in the PDH . Edit: Source:

REV Robotics - 2022 FRC Control System General Forum

posts.name: REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO
Mr.R^2
posts.cooked: As a side note, we were ecstatic Saturday, when we got our benchtop test set up with the PDH (using the new control system), and everything just worked out of the box. It really is a beautiful system.

posts.name: Sky Captain
posts.cooked: Quite alright. I thought I had seen that the 40A work in the old ones, but I am alright in being wrong. I donâ€™t want anyone to fry anything. We managed to get enough to populate a full PDH with spares, so that isnâ€™t an issue for us anymore.  Iâ€™m quite excited to get the new hardware and install it into our test bed.
